body:
thanks @nitin-maharana 
@blueorangutan package
@borisstoyanov a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1153
@blueorangutan test
@borisstoyanov a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
I've added an extra unit test for the changed code, to keep the history intact in relation to the Trillian Tests, I have not squashed yet. I will squash once we have approval.
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1154
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
@resmo is that a regression of sorts, we holding this PR?
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
@syed looks like we have new conflicts
@PranaliM the new test has failed, please see the logs and fix the failure
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1155
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1156
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1157
not sure yet, we are investigating the root cause
darn it! I'll resolve it now
Thanks, @rafaelweingartner for the fix. Code LGTM. Can you please squash both the commits.

@nitin-maharana sure!
I will do that in a sec
@rhtyd Done!

I guess one comment I have is that technically we are supposed to have a JIRA ticket for each PR. Perhaps you could open an enhancement ticket and reference it here, @syed - thanks!
@mike-tutkowski I had opened the ticket in jira a while back. I've edited the PR to add the JIRA ticket
Thanks, @syed!

Mgmt OS options: ['centos6', 'centos7', 'ubuntu']
Hypervisor options: ['kvm-centos6', 'kvm-centos7', 'kvm-ubuntu', 'xenserver-65sp1', 'xenserver-62sp1', 'vmware-60u2', 'vmware-55u3', 'vmware-51u1', 'vmware-50u1']

Note: when additional tests are passed, you need to specify mgmt server os and hypervisor or use the `matrix` command.

@blueorangutan test
LGTM. Thanks @DaanHoogland
@karuturi @sateesh-chodapuneedi @kishankavala, Can you please review this.
I have tested this code in a Basic Zone with XenServer and it worked. Also, the code LGTM. Thanks, @DaanHoogland!
The problem that has prevented me from testing this PR is being addressed in the following PR: https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/pull/2296

I have successfully run all managed-storage regression tests on this PR.

I needed to run all managed-storage regression tests for the following PR: https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/pull/2081

In order to get an environment up and running to run those tests, I included this PR when testing that PR. As a result, the managed-storage regression tests whose results I included above were gathered when I ran those tests against code from https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/pull/2081 and this PR.

@marcaurele I've resumed working on this now. I've squashed changes by authors, after painfully going through 27+ commits while rebasing against the latest master, hope you don't mind. I did not see any classes being overwritten for bountycastle and hence removed it from the exclusion list, do you think that could cause any issues? I'm exploring some ways to further improve the `ServerDaemon` launcher by using a customer properties or yml file that can be used as a single point to configure ports, listening interfaces, https, keystore etc. I've also upgraded several dependencies, notably Spring, bountycastle, and jetty.
